qas.question: When was the tungsten filament introduced?
What was the problem with manufacturing the tungsten filament?

answers.text: Tungsten metal was initially not available in a form that allowed it to be drawn into fine wires.

qas.question: Who developed the ductile form of tungsten?
When was the ductile form of tungsten invented?
What other materials were combined with tungsten?
What was initially available in a form that allowed it to drawn into fine wires?
Who did not develop the ductile form of tungsten?
Where was William D. Coolidge employed in 1902?

context: In <a0_0>1906<a0_0/>, the <b5_0>tungsten filament<b5_0/> was introduced. <a1_0><b6_0>Tungsten metal<b6_0/> was initially not available in a form that allowed it to be drawn into fine wires.<a1_0/> Filaments made from <b7_0>sintered tungsten powder<b7_0/> were quite fragile. By <a3_0>1910<a3_0/>, a process was developed by <a2_0><b8_0>William D. Coolidge<b8_0/><a2_0/> at <b9_0>General Electric<b9_0/> for production of a ductile form of tungsten. The process required pressing tungsten powder into bars, then several steps of sintering, swaging, and then wire drawing. It was found that very pure tungsten formed filaments that sagged in use, and that a very small "doping" treatment with <a4_0>potassium, silicon, and aluminium oxides<a4_0/> at the level of a few hundred parts per million greatly improved the life and durability of the tungsten filaments.
